active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate in groups: In resource-constrained IoT devices, are hardware countermeasures (e.g., masking circuits) or software ones (e.g., constant-time algorithms) more practical and effective against side-channel attacks? Use compare/contrast with real examples like smart cards vs. mobile apps.
active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, assign types of side-channel attacks (timing, power, EM, cache). Partner A explains the attack mechanism and a real-world example using analogies (e.g., power like observing light under door). Partner B does teach-back on countermeasures, then switch.
active_learning.problem_solving: As ethical hackers, assess a hypothetical IoT thermostat for side-channel risks. Outline steps: select tools (oscilloscope, ChipWhisperer simulator), hypothesize leaks (variable execution time on key check), propose tests and mitigations. Apply to real-world smart home security.

additional_activities.activity: Think-pair-share on spotting side-channel risks in everyday IoT (e.g., fitness trackers).
Role-playing attacker-defender negotiation during a pen test.
Group project to design a side-channel assessment checklist for embedded systems.

layer.name: Layer 1
layer.content: Basic terms and concepts: Define side-channel attacks, list observable effects (runtime behavior/timing, energy consumption/power, electromagnetic emanations, cache behavior), distinguish from fault attacks.

layer.name: Layer 2
layer.content: Attack types (timing, simple/differential power analysis, EM analysis, cache attacks); countermeasures (constant-time algorithms, masking, blinding, noise addition); side-channel resistance principles.

layer.name: Layer 3
layer.content: Practical step-by-step procedures for assessment: measurement setups (oscilloscopes, ChipWhisperer for power/EM), data collection (traces), statistical analysis (correlation power analysis); tools (ChipWhisperer, Saleae Logic Analyzer); ethical considerations in pen testing.

layer.name: Layer 4
layer.content: Advanced connections in IoT/embedded pen testing: full assessment plans, industry standards (NIST SP 800-57, OWASP IoT Top 10, FIPS 140-2/3 validation); real-world case studies (e.g., AES implementations); designing resilient systems.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding
